snippet: Mitt Romney has kept up his criticism of China even as the equity firm he co-founded, Bain Capital, maintains its China-related holdings.
abstract: Mitt Romney has kept up his criticism of China even as Bain Capital, equity firm he co-founded, maintains its China-related holdings, complicating his message that China's manufacturing juggernaut is costing America jobs; his campaign insists he has no control over his Chinese investments, valued at up to $2.25 million, since they are held in a blind trust.

byline.original: By SHARON LaFRANIERE and MIKE McINTIRE
byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Beijing. Amy Qin and Shi Da contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney has kept up his criticism of China even as the equity firm he co-founded, Bain Capital, maintains its China-related holdings.

headline.seo: As Romney Repeats Trade Message, Bain Maintains China Ties
headline.main: As Romney Repeats Trade Message, Bain Maintains China Ties
headline.print_headline: Romney’s Trade Message and Bain’s China Ties
